comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: Medal bar: French Legion of Honour, chevalier, French Order of Agricultural Merit, chevalier, (medal unknown) Portuguese Order of St Iago, officer. Neck badges from top all commander class: Italian Order of the Crown, Spanish Order of Isabella the Catholic, Greek Order of the Redeemer, Romanian Order of the Star, Serbian Order of St Sava, Bulgarian Order of Civil Merit, Persian Order of the Sun and the Lion. Breast Star, Spanish Order of Charles III (Commander by Number, ie 3rd Class)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "André Pierre Gabriel Amédée Tardieu (French: [ɑ̃dʁe taʁdjø]; 1876–1945) was three times Prime Minister of France (3 November 1929 – 17 February 1930; 2 March – 4 December 1930; 20 February – 10 May 1932) and a dominant figure of French political life in 1929–1932." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Tardieu

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of April 17, 1917 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70C12FA3E5E1173... reports on his appointment as High Commissioner to the United States. He had been a professor at the School of Political Science and the War Academy (in Paris, presumably).

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: B-59, thanks for providing us his full name. We will add it to our catalog record.
